div.p: From Ernst Betche to Joseph Maiden
ML MSS.1018, Ernest Betche papers, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.
[A second edition of the 'flora' of NSW is desired. Betche notes that in the first he used a different method to write the key than that of M - Neger's 'Flora of Germany' was the guide.]

'If Mueller had only known this method, I have no doubt, he would have used it in his "Key". I wrote the second M.S. without Mr Moore's knowledge, not behind his back, but he did not concern himself about what I was doing with my time, as long as I kept quite and was ready to do the little work of determining the few plants that were sent to him for determination.'
[When Moore sees MS he objects to the key system but he takes part of the MS to Melbourne to have M's opinion.]

'When Mr Moore returned from Melbourne he was a changed man, and was quite enthusiastic about the publication of his book. He told me Mueller like it very much and told him "the arrangement of the book is excellent", of course Mueller could not see the many faults of the book in a hasty inspection of part of the M.S., My own opinion of the book, is, as unbiased as a man can judge his own work, that the arrangement of the book is good but the carrying out of the key system is very faulty […]'
